cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 195 mi WSW of Camaguey, Cuba (85 mi NNE of Grand Cayman)
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northeast across central Cuba tonight, then turning north-northwest and west toward South Florida/the Florida Keys before bending westward into the Gulf of Mexico. It is not forecast to track up the U.S. east coast toward Virginia.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Cuba tonight, then possible coastal encounter with South Florida / Florida Keys late Sunday-Monday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Deerfield Beach FL to Bonita Beach FL and the Florida Keys; Tropical Storm Watch north of Jupiter Inlet FL to the Brevard/Volusia Co. line and north of Bonita Beach to Englewood FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Jupiter Inlet FL to Bonita Beach FL including Lake Okeechobee and the Florida Keys; Storm Surge Watch: Golden Beach FL to Bonita Beach FL and the Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Cuba, South Florida peninsula, Florida Keys, north-western Bahamas, portions of the southern Gulf of Mexico
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: N/A – storm remains well south of Virginia during the 5-day forecast window
weather_observation.wind: Gale-force winds unlikely; peak 34-kt probability only 8% at the closest plotted point in coastal Georgia, even lower for Virginia.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Virginia coast from Eta due to distant track.
weather_observation.rainfall: No heavy rainfall signal for Virginia within forecast window.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minimal to none – routine maritime operations may continue; monitor for indirect long-period swell late next week if Eta lingers in Gulf.
